reviews.raw_text:
We were feeling hungry after an expo in the area and we saw this nearby so decided to give it a go since we've been to similar places and knew it would be self/fast service. They have a small lot but there was parking and it was free in downtown which is hard to come by. Self service like other establishments of this type. Just grab a bowl and tongs and pick out the ingredients you want to eat and got it weighed, picked a flavor of broth or spice blend, paid and grabbed a seat. Made our own sauces and within 10 minutes we had our soupy mix ready to eat.

Flavors were good and the meat variety was plenty and tables cleaned. What more could I ask for in a hungry state. The atmosphere reminded me of a fast paced chinese dining hall in china where service isn't really a thing. It's great for a college or busy work schedule life style when you need to grab food quickly. Even leftovers which you can take with you is self service, just grab the plastic container and bag and off we went after eating.

Service: Dine in
Food: 4

reviews.raw_text:
Warning : Spicy food!!!
If you dont like or cant take spicy, becareful trying this place, this place has Mala spice which is not only spicy but create numb sensation on your tongue!
I ordered the beef bone broth for my hotpot, its really good. They weigh the meat and vegetable per pound, not expensive. No service here, you clean up after yourself. This food is perfect for a cold weather.
Other good thing : they close late.

reviews.raw_text:
Food: 5

Atmosphere: 5

What a find!!! This place is amazing!  It's a per pound broth or hot pot restaurant.  It gives Korea vibes environment, street food vibe.

You don't order!

You pick up a clear bowl and metal tongs:
Full your bowl with all the veggies, herbs, and meats of your liking.
They have more than 50 items to select from.

3 different noodle types, mushrooms. . .

Then you take your bowl to weight in (15.99/ Lb.) select a broth type (4 types).

I suggest to choose the beef broth, medium spicy.

After you get your stuff cooked, then you go make your source, add some garnishes.

Garnishes:
Garlic,
Soy sauce
Chili oil. . .
10+ items

Have fun making your own Korean ramen bowl!!! üî•

Price per person: $10‚Äì20
Food: 5
Service: 5
Atmosphere: 5
Noise level: Moderate noise
Group size: 1 person, 2 people, 3-4 people
Wait time: Up to 10 min
Recommendation for vegetarians: Somewhat recommend

reviews.raw_text:
If you love spicy food, this place is a must-try! YGF Malatang serves real, authentic Asian-style spicy hot pot that‚Äôs super popular among young Asians. If you‚Äôre not afraid of heat and want to see what‚Äôs trending in Asia‚Äôs street food scene, this is the spot.
You‚Äôll often see groups of young girls ordering tons of meat and laughing over steaming bowls of malatang ‚Äî it‚Äôs such a fun vibe. The food is priced by weight ($14.99/lb), and they even deduct the bowl‚Äôs weight before weighing, which makes it super fair. The soup base is free, and the staff are friendly and efficient.
For reference, if you cook at home, slices of meat usually costs around $4‚Äì8/lb, so the price here is reasonable. I usually spend about $20 for a full meal, including a bowl of rice (only $1 and refillable!). Plus, there‚Äôs no mandatory tip, which is great for anyone who eats out often.
If you want to experience how young Asians enjoy spicy food culture ‚Äî and you can handle the heat ‚Äî this is definitely the place to go! üî•

Food: 5
Service: 4
Atmosphere: 3

The food is priced by weight ($14.99/lb), and they even deduct the bowl‚Äôs weight before weighing, which makes it super fair. The soup base is free, and the staff are friendly and efficient.

If you want to experience how young Asians enjoy spicy food culture ‚Äî and you can handle the heat ‚Äî this is definitely the place to go! üî•

I recently visited this restaurant and would like to share my experience. The food itself was delicious, but unfortunately, after eating I experienced stomach problems, which was very disappointing.

In addition, I had a very unpleasant interaction with one of your staff members. On Wednesday around 10 PM, a male staff member (a bit heavyset and wearing glasses) spoke to me very rudely. He told me to clear my own dishes, raising his voice in a very impolite manner. We don‚Äôt mind to do it but we did not know that customers were expected to clear their own dishes, as there was no sign indicating this policy.

reviews.raw_text:
If there was a YGF wall of fame I would be on it. My friend and I have been coming here weekly for the better part of 6 months. YGF used to be great...roll up into the worst parking lot in Los Angeles, squeak by the hammered cybertruck, and go inside the warmly lit restaurant, lose a couple decibels of hearing from the Chinese EDM...it was all the better because of the contrast between exterior (ravaged) and interior (pleasantly smashed). Some time ago this place has become overrun. I don't know when word got out (probably because of all of you writing these reviews about how this is the best YGF in the area...not anymore...) but now all of Los Angeles under the age of 35 is here. Last week we couldn't even get a seat, and there was a haphazard line spinning itself into the main cavity of the restaurant. The whole place is about 50 square feet, so really there was no line, just an abscess of people in the center of the restaurant. You couldn't even navigate to the food bar. The staff, bless them, had no idea how to handle the crowd. Waiting system? The cashier told me to just fight it out for myself. The competition was too fierce; I was out-girlbossed. YGF I know  you're trying to be the next HDL but if you wanted that to happen for yourself you would read a management book and play it more like Diner Dash. PLEASE. It's the Asian Century...I dunno if I'm gonna make it there...

Food: 5
Service: 5
Atmosphere: 1

Like a DIY hot pot restaurant. So much fun. We are both vegan so this was an awesome place to eat a bunch of vegetables and get filled up.

reviews.plain_text:
EASILY THE WORST ASIAN CUISINE I HAVE EVER ALLOWED INTO MY BODY.

I didn‚Äôt get sick or anything, but that food smelled and tasted so so so bad. I got my order in the style of the stir fry, and it was miserable. I thought my girlfriend‚Äôs beef bone broth was gonna be better BUT IT WAS JUST AS CRAP.

I brought it home to my neighbors to try, and they couldn‚Äôt stand it. 8 people passed up on it. If you‚Äôre reading this, so should you. SMH

Never seen such disgusting shameless store before. Gross!!!

reviews.raw_text:
They barley speak any English so it was hard to get food if you don't know how they operate.

My Orders was ready for a whole ten minutes but the server refused to give me my food  as they prioritized finishing door dash orders over in person orders.

The food was very numbing as it didn't really taste like anything but made my tongue numb, it was hard to eat so I wasn't able to finish it but was able to try a little bit of everything, which the meats werent very flavorful and were all mostly frozen.

reviews.raw_text:
Yesterday I spent $37.67 and ordered a lot of lamb, and vegetables, including lotus root, with two slices of each, and chrysanthemum. But when they cooked it and I ate it, there was a lot less meat, and other things, they basically stole them and didn't put them in. There was only one lotus root, which also meant that they stole my ingredients when they were cooking in the kitchen, which is to cut corners and cheat customers. The boss is a wicked person. I have lived in the United States for so long and I have seen it again. Everyone must be careful when you go to eat in the future. Check whether the things you ordered are in there. They will definitely have your ingredients that they won't put in. I will never go there again. The boss cheats customers. I see this place often makes such things. It is like stealing our things. It is so hateful.

Meal type: Dinner
Price per person: $30‚Äì50
Food: 1
Service: 1
Atmosphere: 1

Just a waste of money to go there or order form them. The one time I‚Äôm at there store they forced me to order from a delivery platform while I AM PHYSICALLY IN THE STORE! Food is excellent. I ate malatang 2 or 3 times a week when I was living in China for 5 years. Price is quite high. About 20-30 per person. Atmosphere is pure chaos. Bright lights, super loud music, and very cramped spaces. It's fine if that's the mood though.
